name: oxker
description: Oxker is a self-hosted dashboard for monitoring Docker containers. It provides a clean overview of images, container metrics, statuses, and event logs, ideal for homelab environments.
features: Container overview: View all running and stopped containers with status, uptime, and resource usage at a glance.
Resource monitoring: Track CPU, memory, and network usage per container with real-time updates and historical data.
Log viewing: Access container logs directly from the dashboard with search and filtering capabilities.
Container control: Start, stop, restart, and remove containers through the web interface without command-line access.
Image management: List Docker images with size information and remove unused images to free disk space.
Event tracking: Monitor Docker events like container starts, stops, and errors for system awareness.
Terminal interface: Run in a text-based UI for lightweight monitoring on servers without graphical environments.
Multi-host support: Connect to multiple Docker hosts and switch between them from a single dashboard.
